intro: Echites puncticulosus, commonly known as the punctulate echites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has hairy, branching stems. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in small, raised dots, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators.
